claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling that sensitizes tumors to immune checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination expands the breadth of peptides presented on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

evidence.quote: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.
A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome: 40.6% vs 20.6% - Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases following mRNA vaccination, creating a mechanistic rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.
PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue: 2.4x vs 1.0x - Checkpoint axis became more targetable

claims.caveat: The degree of PD-L1 upregulation may vary across different tumor types and individual patients.

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival outcomes in metastatic patients receiving immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value: p=0.01 - Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely, and vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients.
